ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Some of the papers introduced in the course were very helpful and interesting to read.
Learnt research skills.
Please see comments for ECON 559 evaluation.

I learnt a lot about research and data collection while doing my research paper. I also learnt Stata skills during the course of the semester. Additionally, I learnt how to use the knowledge I acquired in the classroom and apply it to policy issues in developing countries
I learned about the relevant and prominent debates in Development Economics over the past few decades.. I also improved my ability to read, understand and interpret economic research papers.
Interesting discussions of dev papers

ADE was a great course in terms of understanding a broad range of development issues and being exposed to the literature in these fields. The research paper requirement was a brilliant learning experience.
econometrics analysis techniques and classic papers in this area
In depth application of micro techniques to development economics.
Various methods and techniques in dealing with how to measure and evaluate program effects in developmental issues.
Learnt to work with Stata, write a research paper and think about research questions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A lot of room to decide the way the project will be conducted.
This class really didn't have a structure which made it really hard to follow.
Three hours on a Friday are very long.
Please see comments for ECON 559 evaluation.

I think the course has a lot to offer and can be improved with more classroom discussion. One way to do this would be to split the class into teams and ask teams to participate in group discussions to discuss the findings of various Development Economics papers.

I think the content is absolutely fascinating and the debates discussed are definitely relevant. The major weakness would be that I wish we could have had more interaction within the course to discuss the papers.

Strengths: thematically relevant to development Weakness: no ongoing student evaluation (response papers / exams), so when push comes to shove, I didn't always prioritize preparing properly, and doing so would have helped me take more from the course
More interaction in class and discussions on the literature could be a potential area of improvement.
Was able to weave in and out with what we learn in 559

Instead of going through various papers that suggest various techniques, having a stronger thematic flow across would have been useful in being able to tie these papers and techniques to specific areas of how to apply these techniques.
I really enjoyed the content of this course, again I think we would have benefited with a commitment device to make us keep on top of the material a little bit better.
Very helpful in understanding how to formulate research questions and the difficulties one faces in writing research papers.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Good if students are interested in research.

If you are interesting is Development Economics this is a nice course to take. Just know that you will more or less be learning about the field than learning practical skills. For practical skills take Development Econometrics.
Please see comments for ECON 559 evaluation.
I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to work in the field of development economics in the future.
This course is a technical and holistic approach to understanding economic development analysis.
yes
Should ideally have taken 558 first. But rewarding project done at the end of semester.
Yes

This course provides a very detailed and technical appreciation of different methods used in RCTs etc. I would strongly recommend anyone who is serious about developmental economics to consider taking this to build up foundational knowledge about this topic.
Highly recommend the course to students who especially want to go for PhD.
